desc.original: Characteristic by their highly developed carapaces, Ajarakan wrap themselves in molten metal that they rub together to heat up and create explosions. Presumably due to the friction of the metal, they can reach high enough temperatures to melt even the ground or bullets. They can also use their strong limbs to grip onto the ceiling and move around freely, so a hunter must watch out from every angle, including above.
desc: Ajarakan is an aggressive monster that is quick to challenge other monsters such as Rompopolo in fights using its brute strength in battle to grapple opponents with, while also hurling chunks of burning rocks from the ground at hunters as projectiles. It is a strong, fast and agile monster like Rajang, as well as a great climber as seen when it climbs onto metal pipes and volcanic ledges with ease, and leaping from said structures to attack opponents from above.

Ajarakan can ignite its metallic shell and armor with its tail, causing it to glow bright red with intense heat, increasing its attacks with fiery punches, it can even create waves and bursts of magma on the ground to attack with. If threatened enough, they can unleash an ultimate attack, they first spin in place to release explosive dust, then launch themselves into the air and then dive into their opponent to create a large fiery impact. Like other Fanged Beasts, they form large packs and cooperate with each other when hunting or defending themselves, however this does little against versatile apex predators such as Nu Udra that can easily take on several of the Great Apes at once.

desc.original: A flying wyvern that was considered extinct according to documents left behind by the Guild. Their wings have a unique, chain-like blade that can extend and retract freely to reap their prey. They feed on elemental energy absorbed through these chainblades, and are able to convert the energy to unleash dragon element attacks.
desc: Much of Arkveld's ecology is apparently a mystery as most of its kind are said to be extinct, but so far Arkveld appears to be a powerful, aggressive and nomadic monster. It can be seen attacking and challenging other apex predators like Rey Dau and Uth Duna in other habitats seemingly to siphon their energy, which it then converts into dragon element within its body for more power.

Arkveld mainly uses its flexible wing chains to whip and strike at opponents and attack them at close range, or at a distance by extending its chain tendrils. Arkveld can grab and constrict opponents with its tendrils to pin them down before absorbing their energy, or striking them with a claw attack. Arkveld can also split these chained tendrils down the middle to create a second pair, and infuse them with dragon element to create explosive whip strikes and shockwaves. Arkveld can also retract its chain tendrils into large wingblades to smash and slash at enemies. Its tail is also flexible and extendable, which it uses to thrust at enemies behind itself.

Arkveld is surprisingly nimble and acrobatic despite its large size, able to launch acrobatic whip strikes and fast aerial attacks in battle. It will additionally ram opponents with its horns, bite them with its powerful jaws, or swipe at them with its extendable tail.

Arkveld also possesses the powerful Dragon Element. After absorbing enough energy, in which it converts to Dragon Element, it unleashes the Dragon Element from the chainwhip into the ground to create explosion or imbues the chainwhip strikes.

desc.original: Desert-dwelling leviathans that build carapaces out of the fulgurite formed by lightning strikes. They use their flexible skeletons and serpentine bodies to create quicksand traps for unwary prey. Inside their mouths are multiple eye-like sensory organs. The mucus they secrete contains luminous bacteria and is believed to aid visibility while they are submerged and other low-light conditions like sandstorms.
desc: Balahara is a desert-dwelling Leviathan that can deftly swim through the sand by using its tail like a drill. It creates quicksand traps to catch prey, a behavior that seems to be based on the hunting tactic of Antlions. Balahara can also work together in packs of 3 members to overwhelm larger monsters, such as Doshaguma, as shown in their turf war. It is also shown to be capable of clinging to walls and pillars and can spit a mud-like glob or stream of mud from its mouth.

quest_list.name: The Desert Knows Not the Sea

desc.original: Large, white fanged beasts that rule over other Blango, attacking intruders as a pack. Its muscularity and mobility allows it to strike swiftly, even on fresh snow, and pounce from long distances—so hunters with long-range weapons still need to stay on guard. Large tusks are the mark of a powerful leader.
desc: By calling out to its pack, the Blangonga can summon Blangos to fight beside it in battle. Its deadly speed can bewilder the novice hunter, as they can perform a dive that can send them rolling into their foes and deal out massive damage. Blangongas can break ice at their feet and hurl it at hunters to inflict a Snowman status, or break it into ice shrapnel that can send foes flying.
Blangongas are incredibly aggressive creatures. They will ruthlessly attack hunters and prey, yet shy away from anything larger than themselves.

desc.original: Amphibians that use their long tongues to seize and devour prey such as Bulaqchi. Their evolved forelimbs store a sticky mucus-like substance. When agitated, Chatacabra rub their forelimbs against the ground to collect stone and ore, widening the range and destructiveness of their blows.
desc: Chatacabra uses its long tongue to whip at enemies and to lick its own forelimbs, covering them in its own saliva. This saliva has adhesive qualities, allowing stone or other earthen materials to be affixed to its forelimbs, thus strengthening the monster even more by giving it more armor and increasing the power of its punches. Chatacabra also likes to charge at enemies with its mouth wide open.

desc.original: Large fanged beasts with pink fur and a distinct crest, which the males sculpt with plant oils and juices as a sign of virility. Congalala are common in temperate forests and are therefore well researched. They're big eaters and love mushrooms, which they absorb and then exhale as a variety of potent breaths that inflict poison, blast, paralysis, and more.
desc: Despite their apparently adorable appearance, under no circumstances whatsoever should the Congalalas be underestimated. While they are for the most part very docile, they react well to the presence of herbivores, so long as they give a wide berth. They can quickly become aggressive to anything that disrupts feeding or startles them, for example, if they see hunters. When damaged enough, their rage mode is triggered. Most of their upper jaw will be red, as will their backside, which also discharges fart gas, and their aggression increases significantly. They are shown to be heavy sleepers, as even pulling on the creature's different parts of their body doesn't wake it up, unless they sneeze, are damaged, or hear loud roars. They tend to fart at any threats before fleeing or fighting.

desc.original: Fanged beasts that are sometimes seen traveling in packs. Ruggedly built and extremely aggressive, Doshaguma won't hesitate to throw everything they've got at enemies - even other small monsters. They have been known to take prey back to their dens, which sometimes leads to violent disputes.
desc: Doshaguma are said to be very aggressive and territorial. It is also found in a wide-range of habitats. Despite these aggressive traits, Doshaguma can actually form small packs and attack their enemies as a group, usually with a single alpha and two subordinates. The reason why is yet unknown, though it is theorized that it is to allow them to take down prey that they would not be able to on their own. However, Doshaguma's pack behavior is not as much cohesive, but more like they are just sticking together to get a chance of free meal when one of the pack member took down a prey.

They can additionally stand on their hind legs and roar loudly, akin to other Fanged Beasts, to appear larger and more threatening to their opponents. Similar to the Odogaron they have a habit of fighting anything regardless of the other monster's power giving them a berserker type mentality.

Doshaguma in battle mainly rely on their brute strength, using their powerful claws and paws to swipe, slash and smash opponents to the ground. Along with biting opponents with their fangs, they also like to charge at hunters with their jaws wide open to try and devour them. Doshaguma can also pick up and throw the corpses of their prey at hunters as an additional attack, often times, spikeless Ceratonoths.

desc.original: Monsters that drape themselves in their great wings, like a black overcoat. They have no eye sensory organs, so instead they use a scattering of fine scales from their wings to locate prey. When their sensory capacity increases, antennae appear on their heads and they unfurl their wings, entering the aggressive Frenzy State. Their black scales can Frenzy other creatures as well, making them fearsome adversaries
desc: Gore Magala emits pollen-like scales that are used to understand their environment and leave behind a trail that stick to predators and prey, allowing Gore Magala to sense them via heat. These scales also act as the vector for the pathogen known as the Frenzy Virus, which Gore Magala can also transmit with its volatile breath attacks or by scattering pools of its scales around the area.

Gore Magala does not have visible eyes and relies almost exclusively on its scales to detect threats. As it scatters more scales, Gore Magala's senses will gradually become sharper, and the color under its wings will slowly change and get brighter. When its senses are at their highest, two feelers will unfurl from its head and it will release large amounts of scales into the air. The hairs will darken the sky as if an eclipse was in the area and it will begin to walk on all six. This state is known as the Frenzy State, and is characterized by a tremendous increase in strength and aggression from Gore Magala's maximized perception.
Outside of its Frenzy Virus, Gore Magala primarily fights enemies using powerful slashes and grapples from its muscular clawed wingarms, which can easily pin down large monsters such as Goss Harag.

In Monster Hunter Frontier Gore Magala Is an Exotic Species and gains a new rage mode known as True Frenzy. In this state its wings will change shape and Frenzy Crystals will grow across its feelers and neck. It will attack much more ferociously and perform new attacks. Only the strongest Gore Magala can achieve this state.

Gore Magala are highly aggressive monsters that will brutally attack nearly anything they encounter. However, they are also quite intelligent, as they can sometimes play dead to escape dangerous situations, and have been observed to hold grudges against individuals who injure them or drive them off. They are especially aggressive when it is almost time for them to molt into Shagaru Magala.

desc.original: Large wyverns found in Oilwell Basin. They have a developed physique, powerful heat rays, and a host of gases they can emit from their body. Their bony carapaces are famously tough but expose a surprisingly brittle interior once destroyed
desc: While the Gravios seems to have lost its poisonous gas that the premature form, Basarios, possesses, gaps in the Gravios' underside expel a knockout gas potent enough to put many monsters to sleep. Furthermore, these defense mechanisms may be used to deter would-be predators, although there would be few monsters able to penetrate the Gravios's shell. Gravios can also expel flammable gas as a waste product of its 'heat beam', and of its diet.

Gravios is relatively docile until provoked. Like most wyverns, it is fiercely territorial. The Gravios inhabits large areas of the Volcano, where it is sufficiently large enough to incubate and raise its juvenile Basarios.

desc.original: An artificial species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with the power of a monster called Arkveld. It  cannot reproduce and does not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. In addition to absorbing and discharging energy the way other Guardians do, Guardian Arkveld can also absorb elemental energy through the chainblades on its wings and use it for sustenance.
desc: Like other Guardians, Guardian Arkveld can draw power from Wyvern Milk, but also enhance its own abilities by draining power from monsters. This led to it evolving the ability and desire to prey on other Guardians. Driven into a frenzy by an endless thirst for Wyvern Milk and developing a feeding instinct that it could not possibly benefit from, it became a threat to the ecosystem of the Ruins of Wyveria and had to be put down.

Guardian Arkveld's chainblade attacks release explosions that create Wylkrystals on pools of Wyvern Milk. During the final battle, it gains the ability to use Dragon element attacks after feeding from Guardian Seikret pods.

quest_list.name: The Pale Dream of a Lone Shadow

desc.original: An artificial monster species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Doshaguma's power. Guardian Doshaguma, cannot reproduce and do not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. While anything but agile, they're tough enough to charge right through attacks without flinching, making them extremely dangerous.
desc: Like other Guardians, Guardian Doshaguma can harness the power of Wyvern Milk to enhance and sustain themselves, gaining greater power. Their claw attacks release powerful explosions that create Wylkrystals if they come into contact with pools of Wyvern Milk. Their wounds regenerate if not quickly destroyed. Their saliva is corrosive and inflicts Defense Down. They are also aggressive to everything in their way and will attempt to destroy it. Like the regular Doshaguma, Guardian Doshaguma are aggressive towards its own species, but unlike the regular species, it does not do so to establish a pack hierarchy.

desc.original: An artificial monster species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Ebony Odogaron's power. Guardian Ebony Odogaron cannot reproduce and do not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. They will attempt to corner targets with flurries of attacks from their well-developed claws and tails.
desc: Like other Guardians, Guardian Ebony Odogaron can harness the power of Wyvern Milk to enhance and sustain themselves, gaining greater power. Their claw and tail attacks release powerful explosions that create Wylkrystals if they come into contact with pools of Wyvern Milk, which they can then detonate using Dragon attacks. Their wounds regenerate if not quickly destroyed.

desc.original: An artificial monster species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Fulgur Anjanath's power. Guardian Fulgur Anjanath cannot reproduce and do not require food relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. Not only can the lightning charged in their bodies be released as an attack, they can also use it to empower themselves and perform vicious biting attacks.
desc: Like other Guardians, Guardian Fulgur Anjanath can harness the power of Wyvern Milk to enhance and sustain themselves, gaining greater power. Their biting attacks release powerful explosions that create Wylkrystals if they come into contact with pools of Wyvern Milk, which they can then detonate using Thunder attacks. Their wounds regenerate if not quickly destroyed. Guardian Fulgur Anjanath is an extremely aggressive monster that will attack anything it comes into contact with.

desc.original: An artificial monsters species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Rathalos's power. Guardian Rathalos cannot reproduce and do not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. Just like the original Rathalos, they are superior fliers and will attack more violently with their claws while airborne.
desc: Like other Guardians, Guardian Rathalos can harness the power of Wyvern Milk to enhance and sustain themselves, gaining greater power. Their claw attacks release powerful explosions that create Wylkrystals if they come into contact with pools of Wyvern Milk, which they can then detonate using Fire attacks. Their wounds regenerate if not quickly destroyed.

desc.original: Wyverns that can stun enemies by striking their prominent crests to produce powerful flashes of light. Their stretchy, rubbery hide resists blunt impacts and reduces the effectiveness of shock traps. A smart hunter knows the maneuver carefully around the poisonous filth they spew, which drips from ceilings or down slopes.
desc: Gypceros can use its luminous crest to produce dizzying flashes and temporarily disorient foes. Its elastic tail can extend and be used as a whip, and it can spit large globules of poison to intoxicate attackers. Due to its shock-resistant hide and flashing crest, it is immune to both shock traps and flash bombs.
Gypceros is a naturally timid wyvern. However, it is rather intelligent and crafty, as evidenced by its willingness to feign death in order to draw a foe in for a surprise attack.

desc.original: Leviathans that inhabit the Iceshard Cliffs. They have sharp, pincer like tails and peculiar membranes on their necks that catch the wind and keep them aloft. Hirabami can sometimes be sighted nesting in groups along the cliffs, using their scales or foreclaws to cling to walls or ceilings while they sleep.
desc: Hirabami is noteworthy for its ability to levitate on the air without the need for wings, similar to Ibushi and Narwa, using the wind-catching membrane on its neck. It can also use the appendages at the end of its tail to hang from rock arches and cave ceilings. Finally, it can spit an icy projectile from its mouth that can freeze the hunter in place. They can be seen and fought in trios.

desc.original: A leviathan that sits at the peak of the Iceshard Cliff's ecosystem. It surrounds its massive form in cold temperatures via ridge-like cooling organs across its body; the frost its limbs produce doubles as a potent weapon and a way to travel along walls and floating rocks
desc: The Jin Dahaad is the powerful apex predator of the Iceshard Cliffs, and becomes most active during the region's Inclemency, the Frostwinds. The titanic monster uses its own enormous body as a living heat sink, shunting heat to the coppery metallic plates on its head, neck, chest, limbs, and tail to drastically lower both its internal body temperature and that of the surroundings.

It can use this technique in a variety of ways, such as to effortlessly climb on vertical surfaces, despite its enormous size, by super-cooling its limbs and generating ice on its claws to stick to surfaces. By using the plates on its head, it can fire a powerful freezing beam from its jaws that can freeze hunters and even stun other monsters, such as Hirabami. Other times, it will generate icy armor for extra protection against threats. Finally, by pushing its cooling ability to its absolute limit, encasing both itself and the entire area in a caldera of solid ice, sucking foes towards it in an icy vacuum effect (all while the leviathans cooling plates practically burst into flame on its back), before unleashing a near-fatal explosion of snow and steam.

desc.original: Temnocerans native to the Scarlet Forest with distinctive, pirouette-like movements. Their fluids contain a neuroplegic agent which they mix with water to produce red, petal-like bristles on their abdomens. When agitated, Lala Barina open these bristles like a deadly, blossoming flower and release them as florets that paralyze whatever they come into contact with.
desc: Lala Barina can spin a scarlet, glowing silk from their mouths, which they can use for attacking and binding prey or locomotion. They also use it to construct massive scarlet colored nests within the Scarlet Forest. Around these nests can be found "florets" of silk, which indicate its presence. Unlike many other monsters, Lala Barina acts in short but quick movements, and will often pause while considering its next move. In battle it uses its claws, spiked legs, stinger and mandibles to stab and slash opponents with, it can also can shoot flower-like urticating hairs from its abdomen at its foes.

quest_list.name: A Stage of Rose and Thorn

desc.original: Light blue bubbles Reflecting the moonlight. Fragile and ephemeral Like flowers blooming at night Traces of a creature Graceful in its precision Noble, yet beguiling An entrancing vision
desc: Mizutsune secretes a soapy fluid that coats its entire body, which combined with its unique fur allows it to freely slide across terrain with graceful agility. This fluid can also be used offensively to breathe bubbles at enemies, hindering their movement and making them unable to maintain their footing. It can also fire pressurized jets of water from its mouth, much like Plesioth.

Mizutsune in the Forbidden Lands, when it's low on health and enraged, will start releasing fiery bubbles alongside the normal bubbles, similar to its various variation. They are also seen swimming through water.

Mizutsune isn't very aggressive towards hunters and likes to spend its time resting, only reacting violently if provoked first. However, males have been known to go berserk during the mating season, attacking anyone who comes across them. This rage is the reason hunters are requested to hunt them.

desc.original: Temnocerans that inhabit the Iceshard Cliffs. They weave vast, sticky webs across their territory, using them and various status ailments to corner prey before utilizing pincer-like jaws to finish it off. Sometimes dead Gypceros can be found in the webs, the hides of which Nerscylla are known to adorn themselves with after devouring the rest of the carcass.
desc: Nerscylla is adaptable to different environments and capable of spinning a large amount of silk web very quickly. The silk it uses to swing itself across the air and to capture prey is very durable and sticky, so breaking free is difficult. Nerscylla ensnares its prey with the web, then reels them in to strike. The stinger at the tip of its abdomen contains a tranquilizing fluid that can cause the Sleep status. In higher ranks, Nerscylla loses the ability to put hunters to sleep, but gains the Deadly Poison status instead.

Nerscylla found in the Forbidden Lands are known to produce their young, known as Nerscylla Hatchlings in the Iceshard Cliffs, that will swarm any hunter nearby. They also have a habit of playing with their food, as seen when one abducted Rove.

desc.original: The cephalopod that reigns supreme over Oilwell Basin's ecosystem. Usually, when sighted, Nu Udra is covered in oilsilt, but when enraged it will ignite the coating, transfiguring itself into a horror of flame. The oculi that appear on its body and many arms are presumed to be sensory organs, but the truth is still being investigated.
desc: Much about Nu Udra's ecology is a mystery, although it is known to be most active during the "Firespring" inclemency of the Oilwell Basin.

As the apex predator of the Oilwell Basin, it is big and powerful enough to subdue and defeat powerful monsters like Ajarakan, able to hold three with its tentacles at once; it employs this grappling attack to pull hunters towards it so it can finish them off with fire from its siphon. Nu Udra mainly uses its tentacles to sense it's surroundings, as well as weapons to whip and smash enemies. It can additionally attack directly behind with its tentacles without needing to turn to face the hunter. Like real life octopuses, Nu Udra can burrow into the ground to ambush opponents and squeeze through tight spaces to escape from enemies.

When enraged it will open its eyes, its face glows bright orange and it will coat its whole body in fire, allowing it to launch oil fireballs, create heat waves, and whip opponents with its flaming tentacles. Nu Udra can spew large amounts of fire from its siphon to burn opponents from a distance. Its most powerful attack unleashes a furious rain of burning oil in all directions, however this attack extinguishes its fire, exhausts it, and forces it back to its base mode.

desc.original: Brute wyverns with disproportionately long tails. They spread a flammable substance which vaporizes quickly, then ignite it by dragging their tails along the ground. By nature, Quematrice rarely hunt their own prey, and instead scavenge herbivore carrion left behind by other predators. This often leads to confrontations with other, smaller carnivores.
desc: Quematrice's most defining trait is the flammable oil it emits from its tail; this oil, when struck, ignites both the environment and anything unlucky enough to be too close. Quematrice can sweep its tail across the ground to create large waves of fire to burn its enemies. It is known for being rather aggressive, and has a tendency to fight smaller monsters over carrion.

desc.original: Fearsome male wyverns known as the "King of the Skies." Alongside the Rathian, they stake out a wide territory around their nests, and it is the male's role to watch from above. Armed with powerful poisonous claws and fiery breath, Rathalos use their aerial prowess to descend to invaders.
desc: Rathalos are expert flyers, and as such are prone to hunting from the skies. By launching a surprise aerial attack, they can inflict poisonous wounds with their talons or burn prey with flaming projectiles. On the ground, Rathalos remain formidable opponents. Using their powerful legs, they can chase down prey from a distance or inflict blunt-force damage with their clubbed tail. At a close enough range, they are known to use their sharp teeth to bite at foes as well. Some Rathalos are capable of staying in the air and launching a "few" fireballs before landing back to the ground.

Rathalos are highly territorial monsters, and as such, are aggressive towards intruders. They will chase away or attempt to kill any monster which may pose a threat to their land. While hunting, Rathalos will stalk prey from the air before swooping in for the kill. Once they have successfully brought down their prey, they will carry it away to eat in private, safe from scavengers or other large monsters which might attempt to steal the kill.

desc.original: Fire-breathing female wyverns known as the "Queens of the Land." Their powerful legs and venomous tails make them efficient ground hunters. At times, Rathian and Rathalos can be sighted hunting as a couple. After laying eggs, Rathian are extremely watchful of their nests. Proceed with extra caution, as mother will move swiftly to protect her young.
desc: Rathian, like her mate, can generate flaming projectiles from her mouth. She is notably more proficient in the use of this weapon however, as she is commonly seen releasing multiple blasts at once. In addition, she is capable of charging up and releasing a more potent fire blast which can ignite a swath of ground in front of her. She can use the poisonous barbs on her tail club to inflict blunt-force, toxic wounds on foes, even if her tail was cut off. Her powerful legs allow her to run at high speeds, making her easily capable of chasing down most prey. Like the Rathalos, her vision is very keen, so Flash Bombs are useful in combat.

Rathian is very territorial, choosing to patrol from ground while her Rathalos mate patrols from the sky. She will become very aggressive to potential threats, especially when in close proximity to her nest and young. Rathian and Rathalos will always go after hunters that are carrying their eggs.

quest_list.name: Like a Fire Hidden by Sand

desc.original: The flying wyvern that reigns supreme over the Windward Plains' ecosystem. It has adapted to the Sandtide - when it most frequently appears - and is able to store, amplify, and discharge the storm's heavy lightning to lethal effect. Rey Dau is highly territorial and will attack any and all intruders on sight. The fulgurite against its carapace emits a sound that puts every monster in the region on guard.
desc: Rey Dau is the apex predator of the Windward Plains. It has great control over lightning, appearing during thunderstorms and using the electricity in the air to channel, charge and fire massive blasts of lightning from its horns. After blasting lightning, the sand on its wings crystallizes into sharp blades of fulgurite crystal,  enhancing its attacks. Rey Dau can additionally charge its horns with electricity to stab opponents like a electric spear, as well as using acrobatic aerial attacks while slicing opponents with its bladed wings. It often nests at Wind's Gasp.

desc.original: Dappled brute wyverns that prowl Oilwell Basin. They use their tails to inject gas into the ground and detonate it, then feed on the small creatures that are unearthed. The toxic gas they spray from their tongues serve to weaken prey, which they then finish off with the blasts. Rompopolo are extremely territorial and will readily engage their own kind.
desc: Rompopolo mainly attacks by spraying its enemies with poisonous mist from its mouth in the from of sweeping breath attacks, along with lashing at enemies with its long tongue, it can also unleash a concentrated stream of poison gas as a long ranged attack. It will slash at enemies with its front claws and use its tail as a bludgeoning weapon as well.

Rompopolo can also drive its tail stinger into muddy and oily ground in order to inject it with poisonous gases, and cause the ground around it to explode and erupt with oil and tar to heavily damage opponents.

desc.original: The leviathan that reigns supreme over the Scarlet Forest's ecosystem. It has adapted to water-rich environments and is sighted most often during the Downpour. Uth Duna's secretions when combined with water form a protective veil that not only absorbs hostile blows but also adds weight , which it slams down with enough force to sweep away surrounding threats in the resulting wave.
desc: Uth Duna is the apex predator of the Scarlet Forest. It mainly appears during the downpour where the river water levels are higher, giving it an advantage in its watery habitat. Despite its bulky appearance, Uth Duna possesses immense speed and grace when in the water, quickly leaping out of the water and crashing back down to crush its opponents. As well as biting with its large, toothy jaws, it will also swipe at hunters with its large, clawed arms. Its powerful body gives it the ability to create huge splashes and waves to knock hunters off their feet. It can use the surrounding moisture and its body fluids to create a protective veil of water as a defense mechanism, resulting in its watery veiled fins and tail. These water bound appendages provide massive damage reduction from hunter attacks, by breaking these watery fins Uth Duna will become more vulnerable to attack; Conversely, the veil weighs the Leviathan down and with its reduced protection, its attacks become faster and more aggressive.

desc.original: Cephalopod predators whose prey include Guardian monsters. The mucus secreted from their tentacles hardens quickly into sharp edges that resemble blades or spears, which is why some call Xu Wu the "Piercing Assassin." The sizable mouth hidden on their underside allows them to devour even rather large prey.
desc: Xu Wu secretes golden mucus from its limbs that harden into razor-sharp blades. It can swipe these blades and stab at enemies or fling them as projectiles. Xu Wu can also extend its tentacles to a great degree, increasing its attack range greatly. It is remarkably agile and can reposition itself quickly before launching an attack. Its strongest attack has it rear up with its underside and launch itself at enemies for tremendous damage; this can be interrupted to topple it. Occasionally, Xu Wu will surround itself in a thick white mist to distract its foe before flattening its body and quickly repositioning itself around its prey; this mist will leak from the Cephalopods' head when enraged.
Xu Wu is known to feed on Construct monsters, striking quickly with the bladed tentacle before trying to swallow it.

desc.original: Bird wyverns with impressive beaks and large ears. They tend to be skittish but will sometimes initiate attacks on a perceived threat. Yian Kut-Ku arrive in large groups during the season of Plenty in the Scarlet Forest. The absence of eggs or young suggests that the purpose of this is not to breed, but rather seek out mates and nourishment.
desc: The Yian Kut-Ku is capable of moving at high speeds thanks to its light weight and small stature. It is also able to produce flaming projectiles coming from its flame sac, which can be shot from the mouth at attackers. It can spew three flaming projectiles at hunters when enraged and move faster.

A somewhat temperamental, skittish, and inquisitive wyvern. Yian Kut-Ku have a tendency to want to appear bigger than they really are by spreading their wings, flaring out their ears, and squawking loudly. They are generally insectivores, preying on Konchu and other Neopterons as a main part of their diet. In the Scarlet Forest, they are shown to live in packs.

desc.original: A massive Guardian that has been feeding off the Dragontorch's energy. Its body is encased in crystallized Wyvern Milk, allowing it to regenerate. Zoh Shia, like other Guardians, excels at energy attacks and can produce repeated explosions to crystallize the whole area. Beneath its white Guardian coat, its body pulses with dark recollection - which you may see, should it reveal its full power from the days of yore.
desc: Zoh Shia was the ultimate secret weapon of the Ancient Civilization of Wyveria, created to defend the empire against an unknown threat. However, the Elder Dragon-like Construct instead turned out to be too powerful to control and ended up causing the fall of the Ancient Civilization thousands of years ago. The few survivors of the fall had managed to seal Zoh Shia away in the Dragontorch Shrine where it then began to feed on the limitless energy of the Dragontorch (the source of Wylk) that Wyveria once used to manipulate natural phenomena for their own benefit during their golden age. This caused said phenomena (now known as "Inclemencies") to occur regularly throughout the Forbidden Lands, with many species eventually adapting to them.

At first, it attacks with a combination of physical attacks and bursts of Wylk explosions, like other Guardian monsters only on a grander scale. Also like the Guardians, Zoh Shia can regenerate damaged parts of its crystal shell when wounded. Following it's mutation, it becomes much more adept at fire attacks, its abilities rivalling those of all three Fatalis species (it can use the Inferno and charged fireballs of Iceborne's Fatalis, the leaping flames and meteors of Crimson Fatalis, and the Dragon-lightning of White Fatalis).

It is thought to be able to replicate itself through a means similar to asexual reproduction, meaning even after its death it can return; however it must be in close proximity to a massive source of energy, such as the Dragontorch, to be able to do this. Despite this limitation, it can do so if even a microscopic piece of its body remains intact, making it effectively indestructible.
